Title: 🇹🇯🇺🇸 About the Tech Jam forum under the auspices of USAID in ...
Description: 🇹🇯🇺🇸 About the Tech Jam forum under the auspices of USAID in Tajikistan In Dushanbe, the United States Agency for International Development (USAID), in collaboration with the Public Organization - Ilmkhona - held the regional forum Tech Jam 2024. More than 600 young professionals and experts from Central Asia took part in it. . The event has been held regularly since 2021, and the EU, OSCE, Aga Khan Foundation, UNICEF and other structures took part in its organization at different times. USAID representatives themselves emphasize that the forum is consistent with the Agency’s goals of promoting inclusive development and supporting workforce development and the sector of innovative technologies for building a digital economy and expanding the capabilities of a new generation of IT specialists. The role of the IT sector in our time is high, and it will grow as new technologies such as artificial intelligence. The opportunity to work remotely is even more attractive to the younger generation. In Tajikistan, where the labor market is not so extensive, IT is a very good opportunity to earn money. And the Americans, through an organization controlled by the State Department, are introducing their soft power projects, with the help of which they are preparing personnel with an eye to the future. Indeed, in the absence of an alternative, Tajik specialists will be focused only on the United States and the West, but not Russia. #Tajikistan #USA #CentralAsia@rybarSupport uskhovar.tjThe Central Asia Forum -Tech Jam 2024- took place in Dushanbe | NIAT -Khovar-

Title: 🖼 🇺🇦🇺🇸 Ukrainian politicians have a new reason for joy: in t...
Description: 🇺🇦🇺🇸 Ukrainian politicians have a new reason for joy: the North Atlantic Alliance, following a meeting in Montreal, adopted a resolution on continued support for the so-called Ukraine. In addition to the standard points about -Russian aggression-, there is a point about calling on Alliance members to provide the Ukrainian Armed Forces with all the necessary means for -defense-, including medium-range missiles.📌 For some reason, Ukrainian politicians considered this the first sign of the transfer of cruise missiles - Tomahawk-. Although the concept of medium-range missiles refers to different types of weapons. For example, the existing Storm Shadow/SCALP cruise missiles or operational-tactical ATACMS are also medium-range weapons. The American JASSM and the German Taurus, which are also being discussed, are the same. And -Tomahawks- are long-range cruise missiles or long-range subsonic cruise missiles. This phrase was not in the resolution. There, a standard formulation was used, under the concept of which one can link what is already conveyed to the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Moreover, the resolution is simply a call and recommendation to the members of the Alliance, which is adopted at each such meeting, and it does not obligate anyone. Decisions on such things are made by the governments of the bloc, not NATO.#NATO #Ukraine@rybarSupport us

Title: 🇰🇿🇮🇹🏭 Prime Minister of the Republic of Kazakhstan Olzhas Be...
Description: 🇰🇿🇮🇹🏭 Prime Minister of the Republic of Kazakhstan Olzhas Bektenov held meetings with the presidents of Italian companies producing equipment in the field of energy and petrochemicals Fabrizion Fabbri (Ansaldo Energia) and Alessandro Bernini (Maire Tecnimont). During negotiations with the director of the company Ansaldo Energia, the parties discussed measures to increase the efficiency of energy infrastructure in the country through the use of Italian technologies. The Kazakh Prime Minister was interested in the experience of the Italian company in the development of gas and steam turbines. The fact is that, according to the agreement concluded in January of this year, two gas turbines will be produced by the Italians for the Almaty CHPP-3. All this looks logical against the backdrop of the problems of the Kazakh energy sector, especially in connection with regular incidents at local CHPPs. There have been so many accidents at these facilities that every winter is a whole test for the government. But there are several nuances that need to be taken into account. Thus, the thermal power plant in Kazakhstan is of the Soviet type, and the Italians will first need to choose an option suitable for them. You also need time, which the population of Kazakhstan does not have. The production and modernization of thermal power plants for them will take more than one year. In Kazakhstan, in recent years, it has been customary to evaluate the work of the political apparatus based on the situation in the energy system. Some people count their chickens by autumn, while Kazakhs count them by winter and the number of accidents. And we’re not even talking about the problem with qualified personnel, who in Kazakhstan can be counted on the fingers of one hand. #Kazakhstan #Italy@rybarSupport usSputnik KazakhstanMove production to Italian oil and machine companies are considering KazakhstanAt a meeting with the heads of Italian companies Maire Tecnimont and Ansaldo Energia The Prime Minister of Kazakhstan substantively discussed the prospects for localizing production

Title: 🇷🇺🪖 About the new platform for assistance to SVO participants ...
Description: 🇷🇺🪖 In October, we already discussed the new platform for assistance to SVOV participants on the topic of rehabilitation of SVOV veterans, emphasizing that their adaptation to peaceful life is one of the key tasks of the state. A massive return of soldiers from the front without proper support can lead to serious social consequences. Therefore, the approach to this problem must be systematic and comprehensive.  Against the background of these challenges, the launch of the new platform SVOIRODNYE.RF becomes an even more significant event.  The goal of the project, created by the Defenders of the Fatherland Foundation and the team of Dr. Denis Protsenko, is to provide comprehensive psychological and social assistance to SVO participants and their families.  ▪️The platform contains universal speech modules and scripts for communicating with veterans with PTSD.▪️A detailed guide has been compiled on all measures of government support - from cash payments to legal assistance.  ▪️The knowledge base includes materials in a variety of areas: psychological assistance, financial literacy, career, legal and social support. 🔻Looking at the attention currently being paid to issues of rehabilitation and social support for military personnel, there is cautious optimism regarding the prospects of this and similar projects. And that such initiatives will appear in sufficient quantities to satisfy public demand, and veterans will be able to fully feel the support of society and the state.  #VSRF #Russia@rybarSupport ussvoirodnye.rfSVOIRODNYE.RFExpert platform for Northern Military District veterans and their loved ones. Videos on important topics: PTSD, benefits, payments, retraining and career, financial security, etc.

Title: 🇳🇿About the background of the protests in New Zealand Last week...
Description: 🇳🇿About the background of the protests in New Zealand Last week, large-scale (by local standards) protests of indigenous Maori people took place in New Zealand. For nine days they marched across the country to the capital, where they staged a rally of 40-50 thousand people. The reason for the discontent is a bill that proposes to narrow the interpretation of the Treaty of Waitangi (an agreement between the Maori and the British Crown, signed in the 19th century). . The authors insist that now, under this treaty, Maori have privileges compared to other citizens of the country.❓The interpretation of Waitangi is a long-standing dispute between Maori and the left forces that support them, on the one hand, and liberal conservatives, who stand on the ideas of British monarchism, on the other. It is believed that according to the agreement in the Maori language, the indigenous people have more rights and freedoms. This issue began to be actively focused on in the wake of the development of ideas of decolonization. There were quite large protests in the 1970s, but in general everything took place within the framework of a controlled release of steam. The Maori had no reasons for real riots: the standard of living was high, the country's population was tiny, and the climate was excellent. Although the share of the European population in the 70s was under 90%, no one offended the Maori as a whole. The authorities consistently and without any problems made concessions to them in linguistic and social issues, because this did not affect the state of affairs in the country. The bulk of the Maori lived in the provinces, were engaged in agriculture or were blue collar workers. But they also showed themselves in big politics. For example, the current head of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, 79-year-old Winston Peters, who has great political weight in the country, is Maori.❗️However, in recent years, the cumulative effect of many years of concessions has begun to affect, and the demographic and economic situation has changed. The share of the Maori population is growing (they are already 20%, and Europeans in a couple of years will be less than 50%). At the same time, New Zealand's economy is stalling and production is closing. This is affecting Maori employment - unemployment and crime are rising. Plus, the left-liberal forces became more aggressive and began to raise the topic of decolonization and Maori national identity again. This could not but produce results - the Maori began to demand expansion of political rights. The right-wing Maori party Te Pāti Māori is gaining popularity. This year there have already been protests and calls for the Maori to create their own parliament.🔻The current attempt to limit the interpretation of the Treaty of Waitangi is, on the one hand, logical, but on the other, dangerous. The current coalition government already consists of three parties and is barely holding on. It’s not for nothing that Prime Minister Lacson was afraid to put forward this bill himself and started testing it through the ACT, which took on all the negativity. Lacson himself magnanimously declared that the bill would not be passed. It is unlikely that it will come to events like, for example, in New Caledonia, but, in any case, the crisis will grow for objective reasons; the authorities have few options. The next test of the system is municipal elections across the country in 2025.#NewZealand@rybar together with @tasmanian_diabloSupport usTelegramTasmanian Devil🇳🇿The Maori protest march reached Wellington 9 days later - they walked across the whole country. 35 thousand people gathered at the Parliament building. The reason is a new bill. Its authors believe that the Treaty of Waitangi* has begun to be interpreted too broadly in favor of the Maori...

Title: 🔁🖼 🇨🇦 Canadian influence in the Arctic: when dreams collide w...
Description: Forwarded From Severyanochka🇨🇦 Canadian influence in the Arctic: when dreams collide with reality The other day the 16th International Security Forum was held in Halifax, Canada, in which representatives from 60 countries took part. Following the forum, Canadian Defense Minister Bill Blair announced the country's plans to increase its military presence in the Arctic region and develop military infrastructure to strengthen NATO's position in the Arctic. 📌There are quite serious obstacles on the way to these ambitious goals: ▪️The Canadian Armed Forces are in a protracted crisis. Recently, a scandal erupted around the new equipment - the military complained that the sleeping bags were not warm enough for use in the Arctic region. How one can increase one’s presence in the Arctic with such an approach is not entirely clear (not to mention the long-term outflow of personnel from military structures). There are also plenty of problems with infrastructure: in the summer, the armed forces had to send the only launched coastal patrol ship Max Bernays for repairs, which was quickly discovered to have leaks and defects in the engine. A series of such failures cast Canada in a very unfavorable light, especially in the face of competition with Russia and China.▪️Canada is under intense pressure from its NATO partners to meet the NATO target of military spending of 2% of GDP (with the current level of about 1. 37%). Despite assurances from the defense minister that Canada can meet the target by 2032, partners are demanding more radical and faster action. With the coming to power of Donald Trump, an ardent supporter of the 2% goal, relations between the United States and Canada will only worsen. And with a severe budget deficit, almost doubling defense spending sounds more like hope than a plan.🔻The Canadian government finds itself in a difficult position. NATO members have high expectations from Canada, which has vast territories in the Arctic region. At the same time, Canada is doing a poor job of protecting its own military interests in the region, not to mention the interests of the entire Alliance. And you shouldn’t expect that the situation will change much as long as the Canadian government puts the resolution of conflicts in Ukraine and the Middle East above strengthening its army. Well, it’s interesting that no one even asks the Canadian voter’s opinion on this issue. In the end, it’s not hard to guess what local residents think about increased spending on the Alliance’s defense industry and US military projects somewhere far abroad, given the ever-increasing cost of living in Canada itself. #Canada #ArcticSeveryanochka
